subject: Alpine Skiing
lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn, the World Cup overall and downhill champion, bruised her knee when she fell during a routine training session for a super-G at Copper Mountain in Colorado. She was taken to see Dr. William Sterett, the physician for the United States women’s Alpine ski team, who said Vonn had sustained a bruised left knee and that there was no ligament or cartilage damage. Vonn, who had never finished among the top three in the slalom, won the World Cup slalom opener Saturday in Finland.
